intro: Noronhia foveolata subsp. major, commonly known as the large-leafed noronhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger leaf size compared to other members of the species.
